Package Main.MVC

Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
Main.MVC.GameEngine
public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
Public class GameBoard is responsible for loading in the GameBoard, Controller and Renderer. It connects the game timer to the game data which is updated and rendered every cycle to simulate gameplay. It also handles all the inputs by the user such as key presses and mouse clicks.
Since:
28/11/2021
Version:
1.0
Author:
TanZhunXian

    The dimensions of the game screen to draw the pause menu.

    Renderer to render game graphics.
    private java.awt.Rectangle restartButtonRect
    Restart button area.
    private static int TEXT_SIZE
    Text size of 30 for the font to get an estimate of options area.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameEngine

      public GameEngine​(javax.swing.JFrame owner, int[][] choice, GameSounds gameSounds, java.awt.Dimension area) throws java.io.IOException
      This constructor initialises the GameBoard, Controller and Renderer so that the game data can be saved, manipulated and rendered.
      Parameters:
      owner - JFrame used to center screen in ScoreBoard.
      choice - Player choice from custom console to be generated into levels in GameBoard.
      gameSounds - GameSounds to add BGM and sound effects to the game.
      area - Dimensions of the game screen to set game boundaries and draw pause menu.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - This constructor throws IOException if game background image is not found.

  • Method Details

    • handleEvent

      public void handleEvent​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      This method is used to respond to the key inputs by the player.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - The key presses by the player to get the key codes.

    • handleReleaseEvent

      public void handleReleaseEvent()
      This method is used to respond to the key releases by the player.

    • handleMouseClick

      public void handleMouseClick​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is used to respond to the mouse clicks by the player.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The mouse clicks by the player.

    • handleMouseMotion

      public void handleMouseMotion​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method is used to respond to the mouse motion of the player.
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - The mouse motion of the player.

    • update

      public void update() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This method calls the update method in Controller to update game data.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - This method throws FileNotFoundException when audio file is not found.

    • render

      public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method calls the render method in Renderer to render game graphics.
      Parameters:
      g - This is used to control the graphics during the rendering of game graphics.

    • getController

      public GameBoardController getController()
      This method returns the Controller to access the methods within.
      Returns:
      The Controller is returned.

    • getGameBoard

      public GameBoard getGameBoard()
      This method returns the GameBoard to access the data within.
      Returns:
      The GameBoard is returned.

    • drawPauseMenuChoices

      private void drawPauseMenuChoices​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method is used to draw the detection boxes for the pause menu options.
      Parameters:
      g - This parameter is used to get the graphics to draw the detection boxes for the pause menu options.

    • onLostFocus

      public void onLostFocus()
      This method is used to signal to the game that the focus is lost and to show the focus lost message and pause the game.
